His greatest goal has been to get his family ahead, as he has had to face quite difficult financial situations. Sometimes his work hasn’t had the demand expected, and other times he hasn’t had enough capital to satisfy the level of requests, as is currently the case. For this reason he is seeking a loan to buy raw materials to be able to increase his productivity, which will improve his income and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (goldsmithing)

loans.name: Jorge Isaac

texts.es: Para Jorge la vida no ha sido color de rosa, desde muy joven le tocó enfrentarse al mundo laboral debido al fallecimiento de sus padres. Sin educación y con pocas oportunidades de empleo decidió dedicarse a la venta ambulante como medio de sostenimiento. Jorge desea poder tener mayores oportunidades en la vida y mejorar su calidad de vida por lo cual quiere invertir en su negocio con el fin de generar ingresos. Esta seguro que la temporada navideña es una buena oportunidad y por eso se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que espera comprar surtido para la temporada de fin de año.
texts.en: For Jorge life has not been a bed of roses.  He had to face the working world when he was very young because of the death of his parents.  With no education and with few work opportunities he decided to sell on foot in order to support himself.   Jorge would like to have more opportunities and improve his quality of life so he wants to invest in his business in order to increase his income.  He is sure that the Christmas season will provide a good opportunity so he is asking for a loan in order to buy year end merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Luis Ángel

texts.es: Don Luis Ángel es zapatero de profesión. Desde hace 16 años se dedica a la fabricación de calzado, montó su negocio en una de las habitaciones de su casa, debido a que su situación económica no le permite ubicarse en un local. Desde allí elabora su producción que posteriormente comercializa en diferentes municipios del departamento de Antioquia. Luis se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que espera comprar materia prima para aumentar su capacidad de producción y generar mayores ingresos. Su mayor sueño es poder ampliar su negocio y montar una gran empresa  para generar empleos.
texts.en:
Don Luis Ángel is a shoemaker by profession. He has been making shoes for the past 16 years. He started his business in one of the rooms of his house since his financial situation did not permit to open his own shop. The shoes he produces he later sells in different towns in the department of Antioquia.

Luis is requesting a loan to purchase basic materials to increase his production and generate higher earnings. His greatest dream is to expand his business and start a large enterprise and create jobs.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies to make shoes.

loans.name: Luisa Fernánda

texts.es: Luisa Fernanda de 18 años de edad, es una joven llena de sueños y con un proyecto de vida claro. Se encuentra terminando su bachillerato, pero desde ya,  se visiona como una gran empresaria. Es una luchadora y amante a los negocios, por esto se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo con el fin de ahorrar para sus estudios universitarios. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de productos para generar ingresos. Su mayor sueño es poder ser una gran profesional  y poderle colaborar a su madre con las obligaciones del hogar.
texts.en: Luisa Fernanda is 18 years old and is full of dreams and with a clear life’s path.  She is finishing her bachelor’s degree but she already sees herself as a great entrepreneur.  She works hard and loves business, so she sells products via catalog so that she can save up for her university studies.  She is asking for this loan so that she can invest in products that will generate income for her.  Her grandest dream is to be able to be a great professional and be able to help her mother with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Rosas Rojas  (Paute) Group

texts.es:
Rosas Rojas es un banco constituido hace algunos años, está formado por 9 mujeres quienes son amigas y conocidas, las señoras se reúnen una vez al mes para conversar de varios temas y también para salir de la rutina diaria, se caracterizan por ser amables, gentiles y muy carismáticas. Viven en el cantón Paute lugar que goza de una exuberante belleza gracias a sus tierras fértiles donde se cosechan las más hermosas flores, sus hermosos paisajes son inolvidables y el calor de su gente es muy cálido.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora. María Mercedes, forma parte del banco comunal Rosas Rojas hace dos años,  tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 29, 20, 16 y 10 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente y también los fines de semana se dedica a estudiar en un colegio a distancia, su tercera hija está estudiando en el colegio y su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad siendo el fruto de su trabajo.

Doña María Mercedes trabaja de jornalera pero solo cuando le llaman sus conocidas para que realice esta actividad, también se dedica a la cría de cuyes y tiene ganado que le produce leche la misma que es para la venta. Esta cultivando sus terrenos con hortalizas que también son para la venta. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas para sus cultivos, abono y cuyes de mejor calidad.
 
Su meta es ampliar su criadero de cuyes.

Las dos fotos pequeñas son de tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
Rosas Rojas is a communal bank that was started several years ago. It is made up of nine women who are friends and acquaintances. The women meet once a month to talk about various issues and also to take a break from their daily routines. They are known to be friendly, kind and very charismatic. They live in Paute Commune, a place known for its exuberant beauty thanks to it fertile land where the most beautiful flowers are grown. Its beautiful landscapes are unforgettable and its people are very warm.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Maria Mercedes, who has been a member of the Rosas Rojas Communal Bank for two years. She is 49 years old and a single mother of four children, who are 29, 20, 16 and 10 years of age. Her oldest daughter is married and lives independently; her second, a son, works and helps her financially while also taking online classes on weekends; her third, a daughter, is a school student and her youngest, a son, is also studying at a school in the city. She owns her home, which is the fruit of her labor.

Doña María Mercedes works as a day laborer but only when acquaintances call her to perform some task. She also raises guinea pigs and owns cattle, which she milks for sale. She cultivates vegetables in her fields, which she sells, as well. 

Her new loan is to purchase seeds for her plants as well as compost and a better quality of guinea pigs.  Her goal is to expand her guinea pig raising business..

The two small photos are of three members who could not be present when this photo of the group was taken.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Resolucion Group

texts.es: Está formado por tres socias una de ellas es Jessenia que vende ropa usada y ropa nueva desde hace 5 años de forma ambulante y por encargo es una mujer casada tiene dos hijos y su esposo es taxista que le brinda servicio de transporte a la sociedad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa usada por piezas y compra de ropa nueva para adultos y niños, Marlene vende ropa y cosméticos de la Avon, Aura Lila vende productos de cosméticos de la Vogue por encargos.
texts.en: This group is made up of three women.  Jessica has been selling second hand and new clothing to order and on foot for five years.  She is married and has two children.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  She will use the money from this loan to buy new and used clothing for adults and children, by the piece.  Marlene sells clothing and Avon cosmetics.  Aura Lila sells Vogue cosmetics to order.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: El Museo Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios una de ellas es Ileana quien tiene una pulpería y también  compra y vende chatarra,  hace 6 años  de esa forma inicio su negocio con los margen de ganancias que le generaba el comercio de la chatarra fue comprando productos de pulperías en menor escala. Tiene 5 años de estar  con la institución tiene 3 hijos que juntos con  su compañero de vida le ayuda en la compra y venta  de chatarra, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, papel higiénico etc. Sobeyda vende productos Herbalife y venta de CD ambulante y Edwin fabrica guitarra en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This is a group consisting of three people.  One of them is Ileana who has a grocery store and also buys and sells scrap metal.  She’s been in business six years.  She started the store with profits generated from the scrap metal business.  She gradually bought grocery items on a small scale.  She’s been with the institution five years and she has 3 children; her life companion helps her with the buying and selling of scrap metal.  She will use the loan to buy basic grains like rice and beans, sugar, oil, toilet paper, etc.

Sobeyda sells Herbalife products and CDs from place to place and Edwin manufactures guitars at home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La Señora. María se encuentra realizando el tercer crédito en el banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por el centro de la Ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de un clima frió, esta bañada por 4 ríos, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999 gracias a su arquitectura colonial, su gente es amable, gentil y aun conservan la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. María es madre soltera, tiene 30 años de edad y ha concebido un hijo de 6 años de edad que está estudiando en una escuelita de la cuidad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Ella trabaja como empleada en una pastelería de la cual gana un sueldo mensual, también realiza pasteles, galletas, etc. pero independientemente desde su casa cuando le hacen algún pedido, se dedica a esta actividad económica hace 8 años. Los fines de semana le ayuda a su madre a la venta de comida, ellas realizan toda clase de platos.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de moldes, vitrinas y harina para continuar creciendo en su negocio de pasteles.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora María is requesting her third loan from the communal bank Renacer Uncovia.  She lives in the center of Cuenca, a city that has a cold climate, is bathed by four rivers and has been, thanks to its colonial architecture and friendly, kind people that still preserve their culture and village traditions, a World Heritage site since 1999.

Señora María is a 30-year old single mother who has a 6-year old son.  Her son goes to a small school in the city.  She does not have her own home and instead is a renter. 
 
Señora María works in a bakery and is paid a monthly salary.  She also makes cakes and cookies etc. independently in her home whenever she has orders. She has had her business for eight years.  On weekends, she helps her mother to sell food; they make all kinds of dishes. 

She is going to invest her loan in the purchase of baking molds, display cases and flour to continue growing her own pastry business. 

Señora María's goal is to own her own home.

loans.use: to purchase baking molds, display cases and flour.

loans.name: Camino De Luz Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias una de ellas es Mildred quien tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo menor de 6 años, se dedica a vender carne de res, cosméticos de la Avon, ropa nueva desde 18 meses, el crédito lo solicita para invertir en la compra de una res, y compra de zapatos, ropa, cosméticos por encargos. Mireya vende sandalias, y ropa nueva, Maria Magnolia vende ropa y sandalias.
texts.en:
This is a group formed by three members.  One of them is Mildred who is 27-years-old, married and has a six-year-old son.  She’s sold beef, Avon cosmetics and new clothes for 18 months.  She will use the loan to buy a head of cattle and to buy shoes, clothes and cosmetics to order. 

Mireya sells sandals and new clothes and María Magnolia sells clothes and sandals.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle, shoes, clothes and Avon cosmetics.

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” y con la venta de carne, papa, chuño, haba verde, moraya y queso. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la venta verduras y le va muy bien. Solicita el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro.  Es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues in the “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” communal bank and selling meat, potatoes, dehydrated potatoes, green lima beans, dried tuber and cheese.  She’s been selling vegetables for many years now and does very well.  She requests the loan to repair her cart.  She’s a responsible, kind person who supports her family and is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to repair her cart.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” y con la elaboración de pan. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como sacos de harina.  Es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues in the “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” communal bank and baking bread.  She’s been in this business for years and does very well.  She’s requesting the loan to buy supplies like sacks of flour.  She’s a responsible, kind person who supports her family and is happy with the loan and committed to making her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour.

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” y con la elaboración y venta de pan. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de harina, sacos de azúcar, manteca y otras cosas más. Es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues in the “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” communal bank and baking bread to sell.  She’s been in business several years now and does very well.  She’s requesting the loan to buy ingredients like sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, shortening and other things.  She’s a responsible, kind person who supports her family and is happy with the loan; she’s committed to making her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, shortening and other things.

loans.name: Candy Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellas es Carlota que hace 10 años vende prendas de plata y oro , es casada, tiene 43 años y cuatro hijos de 29, 28,20 y 7 años de edad. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de oro y  plata como pulseras, chapas, anillos, cadenas, brazaletes etc. Juana tiene un kiosco ubicado en un colegio cercano a su domicilio y Byron vende frutas en un mercado capitalino.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three partner entrepreneurs. One of them is Carlota, who has been selling gold and silver pieces for ten years. She is married, 43, and has four children ages 29, 28, 20 and 7. She will invest the loan in the purchase of gold and silver pieces such as bracelets, badges, rings, chains, etc. 

Regarding the other two partners, Juana has a kiosk located in a high school close to her home, and Byron sells fruit in a market in the capital.

loans.use: to invest in gold and silver pieces such as rings, earrings, bracelets, chains, and badges

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” y con la venta de productos de primera necesidad es decir tiene una péquela tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo tarros de leche, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, sacos de fideos, sacos de harinas, latas de aceites, huevos y otras cosas más. Es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues as a member of the “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” communal bank and selling basic staples; that is she has a small grocery store at home.  She’s been in business for several years now and does very well.  She’s asking for the loan to buy merchandise like jugs of milk, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, sacks of noodles, sacks of flour, cans of oil, eggs and many more things.  She’s a responsible, kind person who supports her family and is happy with the loan and committed to making her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Alis Gioconda

texts.es:
La Señora Alis se encuentra realizando su cuarto crédito en el banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, este grupo se reúne todos los meses en las oficinas de la fundación. Vive por el sector la Uncovia en la Ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de un clima frió, esta bañada por 4 ríos, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999 gracias a su arquitectura colonial, su gente es amable, gentil y aun conservan la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Alis tiene 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 17 y 13 años y un bebé recién nacido, son hijos mayores estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, Su esposo es de profesión árbitro, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Ella hace algún tiempo se dedica a la venta de comida, esta actividad  la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que es un negocio propio y le encanta cocinar, con  este trabajo vio la oportunidad para salir adelante y ayudar económicamente a su familia.
 
Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de víveres para su negocio, en los pagos de dicho crédito no tuvo ninguna dificultad. Ella esta repitiendo el crédito ya que quiere comprar sillas, mesas y víveres para continuar creciendo en su negocio. El banco comunal le gusta por el compañerismo que existe entre todos los integrantes del grupo.
texts.en:
Alis is taking out her fourth loan in the “Uncovia” communal bank.  This group meets monthly in the foundation’s offices.  She lives in the city of Cuenca’s Uncovia sector.  This city enjoys a cold climate and is bathed by four rivers.  It’s been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity since December, 1999, thanks to its colonial architecture.  Its residents are kind, gracious people and they still retain the culture and tradition of its peoples.

Alis is 38-years-old and lives in a free union; she’s had three children who are 17 and 13 years old and a newborn baby boy.  Her older children attend a secondary school in the city.  Her husband is a referee.  She does not own a house; she rents.

She’s been working selling food for some time now, an activity she does gladly because it’s her own business and she loves to cook.  She saw in this work an opportunity to get ahead and help her family economically.

She used her previous loan to buy foodstuffs for her business and had no problem making the payments on this loan.  On this occasion, she’s repeating the loan because she wants to buy tables, chairs and foodstuffs to continue expanding the business.  She likes the communal bank because of the fellowship that exists among all the group members.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Sol De Oro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL DE ORO”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Benedicta ella es separada y tiene 52 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia se dedica a la venta de comida ,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria por las mañanas para luego ir a su otro negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo e esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz y leche para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de papa helada, venta de frasadas, confeccion de busos, movilidad escolar, carpintería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to the “Sol de Oro” (Golden Sun) communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  Benedicta, 52, is separated and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with a grocery store.  She sells various types of products like rice, sugar, milk, snacks, soft-drinks, etc.  She’s been in business for years and does quite well thanks to the effort she puts into it daily.  She also sells food from place to place in the morning and then heads to her other business, the grocery store.  She’s a responsible, enterprising person who has supported her family this way.  She’s requesting the loan to buy merchandise like rice and milk for the store.  She is grateful to all who share her dream by this means and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.  The other group members sell frozen potatoes, blankets, make sweatshirts, drive a school bus and work in carpentry.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise like rice and milk for her store.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es: Jhon nació en la provincia de Manu del departamento de Madre de Dios pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Lucre de la provincia del Cusco, él tiene 42 años de edad y está casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos. El socio Jhon tiene diferentes tipos de actividades como por ejemplo es albañil y es panadero, él tiene un horno que esta implementado con las necesidades básicas pero el local es alquilado. Ya son 7 años que se dedica a la venta y elaboración de panes. En esta oportunidad Jhon requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de harina, sacos de azúcar, manteca y otras cosas más. El socio Jhon pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Jhon was born in the province of Manu in the department of Madre de Dios but currently lives in the city of Lucre in the province of Cusco. He is 42 years old, married, and the fruit of this beautiful relationship is his three children.

Jhon has different types of activities, such as, for example, he is a mason and a baker. He has an oven that is fitted out with the basic necessities but the facility is rented.

He has been making and selling bread for seven years. At this time Jhon needs a loan in order to buy sacks of flour, bags of sugar, butter and some other things.

Jhon belongs to the communal bank “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” with the Asociación Arariwa of the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, bags of sugar, butter, and other things for his bakery.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es una mujer que tiene un gran carisma, es alegre y siempre ve la vida positivamente, es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia desde hace algún tiempo, vive por el sector de la Uncovia en la Ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de un clima frió, esta bañada por 4 ríos, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999 gracias a su arquitectura colonial, su gente es amable, gentil y aun conservan la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Rosa tiene 61 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos, 7 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hija soltera trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. Su esposo se dedica al comercio, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Rosa trabaja arduamente en su negocio de comida, antes lo realizaba ambulantemente pero hoy cuenta con un local, esta actividad la desempeña hace algunos años ya que le gusta cocinar y es un trabajo que le permite mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar. 

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de una refrigeradora para su negocio, la cancelación de dicho crédito lo realizo sin ninguna dificultad. Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que necesita comprar mesas y sillas para seguir creciendo en su negocio. La banca comunal le gusta por el compañerismo y la solidaridad de todas sus socias.
texts.en:
Rosa is a woman with great charisma, who is joyful and always looks at life positively. She has been a member of the community bank Renacer Uncovia for some time. She lives in the sector of Uncovia in the city of Cuenca, a city which has a cold climate and four rivers, and has been a Cultural Heritage Site since December 1999 due to its colonial architecture. Its people are friendly, gentle, and still preserve the culture and traditions from their towns. 

Rosa is 61, married, and in her conjugal union has conceived eight children, seven of which are married and live independently. Her single daughter works and helps her financially. Her husband makes a living in commerce. They do not have their own home so they live in a rental.

Rosa works hard in her food business. Before, she sold her products on foot, but now she has a shop. She has been doing this for several years since she likes to cook and this is a job that allows her to improve the financial stability of her home.

Her previous loan was invested in the purchase of a refrigerator for her business. She paid back said loan without any difficulty. She is getting another loan because she needs to buy tables and chairs in order to keep expanding her business. She likes the community bank because of the camaraderie and solidarity of all its members.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” y con la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, verduras, aceite, condimentos y otras cosas más. Es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues with the communal bank “Señor de Qoyliority de Lucre" and as a traveling food vendor.

She has been working in this business for some years and is doing very well. She is asking for a loan to buy supplies, such as, for example, sacks of rice, bags of sugar, vegetables, oil, condiments and some other things.

She is a responsible and friendly person who provides for her family and she is happy for the loan and she promises to complete her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as, for example, sacks of rice, bags of sugar, vegetables, oil, condiments and other things

loans.name: Pinos Del Caribe Group

texts.es: Socios formados por cuatro microempresarios emprendedores una de ella es Paula mujer de 39 años de edad, es acompañada y tiene 3 hijos uno de 3, 11 y 14 años de edad, desde hace 2 años tiene una pulpería en su domicilio, su hijo mayor le mira el negocio medio tiempo ya que la cliente es docente que imparte clases en un colegio de primaria cercano a su domicilio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, etc. Guissell tiene una pulpería en su casa, Eveling hace y vende nacatamales y Cesar hace y vende nacatamales en su domicilio viernes, sábado y domingo.
texts.en:
A group consisting of four micro entrepreneurs.  One of them is Paula, a 39-year-old woman who has a companion and three children who are 3, 11 and 14 years of age.  She’s had a home-based grocery store for two years.  Her oldest son watches the store half-time because she’s a teacher and works teaching class at an elementary school near her house.  She will use the loan to buy basic grains like rice and beans, sugar, oil, etc.

Guissell has a home-based grocery store, Eveling makes nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] to sell and Cesar makes nacatamales to sell at home on Friday, Saturday and Sunday.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es: La socia Ermelinda nació en el distrito de Cusco de la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Lucre, ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos. La socia Ermelinda tiene un pequeño restaurante donde prepara almuerzo. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al desempeño que realiza en su restaurante. La socia Ermelinda también se dedica a la venta de platos típicos de la región como por ejemplo chiriucho en las fiestas patronales, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos arroz, sacos azúcar y otras cosas más. El sueño de la socia Ermelinda es comprarse una casa pues actualmente vive en una casa alquilada. La socia Ermelinda pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en: Ermelinda was born in Cusco District in Cusco Province and Department but currently lives in the city of Lucre.  She’s 40-years-old, married and four children are the fruit of this beautiful relationship.  Ermelinda has a small restaurant where she prepares lunch.  She’s been in business two years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts in to the restaurant.  Ermelinda also sells traditional, regional dishes like ‘chiriuchu’ [a complex dish, bringing together in a towering mountain parched corn, different meats, and food from watery realms; it’s served cold] during patron saint festival days.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy some ingredients like sacks of rice, sacks of sugar and some other things too.  Ermelinda’s dream is to buy a house because she currently lives in a rented house.  She belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” communal bank in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sacks of rice, sacks of sugar and other things.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” y con la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y también se dedica al guiado de turistas. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Solicita el préstamo para comprar para cuyes. Es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues in Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre Communal Bank and raising small animals such as guinea pigs.  She also makes a living as a tour guide.  She has been in this business for several years and it's going very well for her.

She's requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs.

She's a responsible and kind person who gets her family ahead.  She's happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Irais

texts.es:
La señora Irais y su esposo el señor Fernando tiene ya más de un año dedicándose a negocio de venta de ropa usa y artículos para el hogar. 
Están solicitando un préstamo para invertir en otro tipo de negocio que es la elaboración y venta de comida (que son tacos de guidados) le están ofreciendo un puesta en muy buenas condiciones a un precio muy bajo y desea aprovechar la oportunidad y comprar el puesta para iniciar su negocio de tacos mañaneros.
Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de venta de ropa será para pagar el crédito y con el ingreso que obtiene el señor Fernando de sus trabajos como jardinero en diferentes partes de la ciudad es para los gastos familiares y escolares de sus dos hijos que actualmente estudian la secundaria.
Desean mejorar la calidad de vida y darles lo mejor a sus hijos para que sean unos triunfadores.
texts.en:
Irais and her husband Fernando have been working for more than a year in a business selling used clothing and household items.

They are asking for a loan to invest in another type of business which is the making and selling of food which are tacos made of a stew mixture and there is an offering of a stand in good condition at a very low price and she wants to take advantage of the opportunity to buy the stand in order to start the early morning tacos.

With the earnings she gets from her clothing sales business she will be able to make the payments and the income that Fernando gets from his work as a gardener in different parts of the city is for the family and school expenses of their two children who are currently in secondary school.

They want to improve the quality of life and provide the best for their children to be successful people.

loans.use: to buy a stand in order to have a place to make and sell tacos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 33 years old and still single. She dreams of becoming successful and financially stable in the future, so that she is able to support her parents and her niece and nephews in their financial needs in school. 

Lea engages in the hog-raising business to generate income. She plans to raise more pigs to sell, but she has inadequate capital. Therefore, she is requesting an additional 16,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise. She mentioned that her loan will enable her to make an improvement in the business. 

Lea believes that someday she will increase the number of pigs to sell in the future. She hopes that her business will become more viable and profitable to help her family and cousins who are financially incapable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned good, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Valeri

texts.en: Valeri is 32 years old from the small village of Kvareli District, Kakheti Region, East Georgia. Valeri has a large family: his wife, parents, 2 brothers, his sister-in-law, and his grandmother. The family is involved in an agricultural business. Specifically, they have 2 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. In addition, they have a 0.5 hectare vineyard and 2 hectares of agricultural land, where watermelons and maize are grown. Besides this, Valeri has a tractor and serves his villagers, which earns him a monthly income. Valeri is very hardworking man and does his best to ensure a good harvest. Valeri requested a loan for cultivating the land. After the land is cultivated properly, he will be able to sow maize and watermelon seeds and sell the harvested products. It will increase the income of the family, and they will improve their living conditions. Valeri awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate the land and sow maize and watermelon

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh was born in 1973. She has four children who have are learning at the 4th, 6th, 9th, and 12th grade. She and her husband make and sell food, which is served at night. Hanh has done this job for 11 years. She makes 2,500,000 VND (Vietnamese dong) a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,000,000 dong per month. 

Hanh has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 dong and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 dong to buy more chairs, tables, and ingredients for her food stall. 

She wants to use the profits to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy more chairs, tables, and ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a responsible mother who supports her husband in generating income for the sake of her family. She is 38 years old and has five school-age children. She engages herself in the buying and selling of fruits and vegetables in their community to supplement her husband's income. 

Due to financial difficulty, she aims to strengthen the business to make it a viable source of income. She plans to acquire more fruits and vegetables to sell, but she does not have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for an additional 10,000 PHP to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell. 

She is hoping that her business will be improve and become a viable source of income through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, who is 43 years old, is a responsible mother and the operator of a motorcycle service that has been in operation for seven years. Working hard every day just to meet the needs of her family, she also sells vegetable in the village for additional income. 

Teresita has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) to buy paint for her motorcycle and more vegetables to sell. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of her family, improve their standard of living, and save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy paint for her motorcycle, as well as more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a little entrepreneur who sells fruits and meat to the people in her village. She is 54 years old and has four children whom she lives with. 

She would like to keep her income increasing. For this, she is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy meat, bananas, and vegetables such as eggplant and squash to sell. 

Someday, with good earnings, she will build up a larger stall to comfortably sell from, as well as meet a contented life.

loans.use: to buy meat, bananas, and vegetables such as eggplant and squash to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 38 years old and is married to Vic. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with three children. To generate income, Rosalina sells food around their village using her bike. She wants to have more snacks to sell, so she is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy "kikyam," (squid balls) and "kwek-kwek," (fish balls) to sell in their local community. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy "kikyam," (squid balls) and "kwek-kwek," (fish balls) to sell in her community

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan was born in 1964. She has three children, who are employees and have gotten married. She and her husband sell beverages like beer and tea to earn a living. She makes 2,500,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from it. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 dong per month. 

Ngan has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 dong and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 dong to buy more chairs, tables, beer, soft drinks, and tea leaves to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy more chairs, tables, beer, soft drinks, and tea leaves to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance needed by the motorcycle she employs in her transport business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is from the village of Amistad, a place where she generates income. Erlinda is married to Mario. They have been blessed with four children. As of now, Erlinda is engaged in a direct-selling business. She has been in her business for four years and earns a maximum of PHP 2,500 per week. Right now, Erlinda is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy clothes, cologne, lipstick and lotion, to offer and sell in her village. She believes that she can obtain and improve her income with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cologne, lipstick and lotion, to sell in her village

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan was born in 1939. She has six children who are married. Her husband is dead. Lan sells bamboo to earn a living. She gets 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from it. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more bamboo to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Them

texts.en:
Them was born in 1971. She has three children. The oldest child is a worker. The two others are in the 9th grade. Her husband is a driver. Them sells cement bags to earn a living. She gets 2,500,000 dong (VND) per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more ingredients to make plastic bags and cement bags to sell. She wants to use her profits to raise her children up well.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make plastic bags and cement bags to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish for resale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 32 years old, married but has no children yet. She is a graduate from college but due to lack of job opportunities, she engages herself in  a business to help her husband in generating income for their family. 

Jocelyn runs a small variety store in the local community, selling different grocery items. She plans to improve the business to increase her income.  Due to limited capital, she is requesting for an additional of PHP 10,000 to buy softdrinks, bread, soap, noodles, canned goods, eggs and beverages for sale.  She believes that the loan will help her to further improve the business to make it a viable and profitable source of income.

loans.use: buy stocks for her store

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en:
Shakila is a 46-year-old hard-working married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past ten years. She has become popular in her community and supports well the needs of her family members. Her husband is laborer, but he does not earn enough to support his family well, so he encourages Shakila to contribute to the family income by using her skills. 

Shakila is a mother of seven children. She wants to grow her business.  She requested a loan of Rs 25000 to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to complete the orders on time. She expects a boost in her net income and wishes to spend part of the revenues on the renovation of her house.

loans.use: buy embroidery supplies

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa was born in 1963. She has two children. Her oldest child is married. The younger child sells telephones for a living.  She and her husband sell motorbike parts to earn a living. She has done this job for 20 years. She gains from it 2,500,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,500,000 VND per month. 

Hoa has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009.  In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy motorcycle repair tools to sell in her store.

loans.use: buy motorcycle repair tools to sell

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet was born in 1969. She has four children. Her oldest child is an accountant. Her younger children are studying in the 5th and the 11th grade. Her husband has a grocery store. His monthly income is about 3,000,000 dong (VND).  Nguyet repairs and sells second-hand bicycles to earn a living. She gains from it VND 2,500,000 a month. Her family’s total earnings are about VND 5,500,000 per month. 

Nguyet has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle, she borrowed VND 9,632,000 and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND 9,632,000 to buy more second-hand bicycles to repair and sell in her store. She wants to use the profit to raise her children up well.

loans.use: buy used bicycles to repair and sell

loans.name: Yemen And Kuwait Group

texts.en:
This group is called Yemen And Kuwait Group which consists of three men and one woman, all of whom live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 300000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

One member, Nadhal, is 43 years old. She is married and has five children who are studying in school. Nadhal is a hardworking woman who works at Yemen And Kuwait Bank. She gets a low salary which is not enough to buy what she needs. She applied for a loan of 80000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy medicines for her son's business

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Mrs Razia is a 42-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last five years. She offers everyday products at reasonable prices and enjoys dealing her customers. She is a mother of six children. She is motivated to provide good education and other basic facilities to her family. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She has been in association with Kashf for three years. 

Now she requested a loan of PKR 30,000. She will use part of this loan to buy a stock of rice and flour from the market at lower prices. She then would be able to meet consistently the increasing demand for these items. In addition, she wishes to use part of the loan to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice and flour for her store at lower prices, to pay some personal expenses, and to increase her available working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cloth and beads for embroidery.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 20-year-old single lady. She has one older married sister and two younger brothers. 
Fatmeh is a university student majoring in child care and education. She has applied for an educational loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en: Saleem is still living with his six siblings. He is now a third-year student majoring in Computer Information Systems. Saleem has applied for this educational loan in order to help him pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en: Ghada has shifted her business to selling blankets and some food products. She wants to add selling home and kitchen appliances too, as she has found that most orders are from those categories; for that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add selling home and kitchen appliances

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
A 40-year-old mother of three sons and one daughter, Khawla is a conservative woman who asked her husband Khaled to take her place in the photo. Her husband supports the family from the income he earns selling sweets.

Khawla is trying to help in paying some of the household bills, so she started selling jewelry at home. She is now requesting this loan to purchase a new collection of bead accessories so as to increase both the quantity and variety of her jewelry products.

loans.use: to add a new collection of bead accessories.

loans.name: Alba Lucía

texts.es: Alba de 47 años de edad  se dedica a al elaboración de accesorios, desde hace más de 12 años. Actividad que disfruta porque su mayor pasión es innovar. Sus diseños exclusivos le han permitido participar en ferias en donde tiene la oportunidad de mostrar sus diseños y de paso aprovecha para venderlos. Su mayor sueño es poder tener su marca registrada y que sea reconocida. En estos  momentos se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el comprará materiales para seguir con su actividad, la cual es su única entrada económica y fuente de sustento
texts.en:
Alba is 47 years old she has been making a living by making accessories for over 12 years. This is an activity she enjoys because her biggest passion is innovation. Her exclusive designs have enabled her to take part in fairs where she has the chance to display her designs and uses the opportunity to sell them. 

Her greatest dream is to have a registered brand name which will be recognised. She is currently requesting a loan with which she will buy materials to continue with her activity, which is her only income and her means of livelihood.

loans.use: buy materials to make accessories

loans.name: Adla

texts.en:
Adla is a conservative woman who asked her son to appear in the photo instead.

Adla is a 60-year-old mother of three sons. One of them is Mohammad, who shows up in the photo. He has a hobby of fixing computers. He decided to turn his hobby into a business. For that, Adla chose to apply for this loan to support her son and get some computer parts and a few programming CDs.

loans.use: to buy some computer parts and a few programming CDs for her son's business.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdalene lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns an electronics shop, a business she has been operating for two years now. In this business, she sells electronic tax registers and also does repairs of the same machines.

Magdalene learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group and she joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve on her business operations. Her main challenge is occasional low demand.

Magdalene is applying a loan of 73,100 Kenyan shillings to buy electronic tax registers and spare parts. Her extra income will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family. She aspires to expand and own a larger electronics repair shop where she will be selling electronics.

loans.use: buy electronic tax registers and spare parts

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud is a 28-year-old married woman who is looking after her five children. She has a home appliances (housewares) sales business at home that she established a while ago to help in supporting the family. 

Now Kholoud has applied for this youth loan so she can increase the quantity she has of products and therefore increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more home appliances to sell.

loans.name: Heberth

texts.es: Heberth es un campesino dedicado desde su niñez a actividades agropecuarias, por lo cual conoce bien el oficio y lo hace con gran amor. Actualmente se ha dedicado a la cría y engorde de pollos. A demás se encuentra en búsqueda de solicitar un crédito para la compra de gallinas ponedoras para  la venta de huevos. Su labor le ha permitido ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Sus hijos son la fuerza que lo ha motivado a formar empresa ya que desea poder generar mayores ingresos para enviar a sus hijos a la capital y poderles brindar estudio universitario.
texts.en:
Herberth is a farmer, and he has been farming since he was a child.  He therefore knows this line of work very well, and he does it with great love.  He has currently been raising and fattening chickens.

He is now requesting a loan to buy laying hens in order to sell eggs.  

His work has allowed him to give his family a better quality of life.  His children are the force that has motivated him to set up the business.  This is because he wishes to be able to generate more income in order to send his children to the capital.  He wishes to be able to give them a college education.

loans.use: to buy laying hens.

loans.name: Javier Eskil

texts.es: En ocasiones las dificultades se traducen en grandes oportunidades, este es el caso  de Javier de 44 años, que tras haber perdido su empleo, tomo la determinación de no quedarse de manos cruzados e ingeniarse la forma de ganar dinero para sostener a su esposa y a sus dos hijos. Decidió montar un puesto de refrescos naturales en el que labora todos los días de 9 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde, “este trabajo es una bendición” asegura Javier, pues aunque sus ingresos no son muy elevados le permiten llevar a su casa el pan diario. En estos momentos se encuentra solicitando un crédito para el mejoramiento del puesto de jugos y compra de mercancía. Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar su negocio para que su situación económica cambie.
texts.en:
Sometimes difficulties turn into great opportunities.  This is the case with Javier, age 44.  Having lost his employment, he became determined to not sit around with his hands crossed.  He devised a way to earn money to support his wife and children.

He established a stand selling natural soft drinks.  He works at his business every day from nine in the morning until six at night.  “This work is a blessing,” Javier states.  Even though his earnings are not very high, they allow him to bring home the daily bread.

He is now requesting a loan to improve his juice stand and to buy merchandise.  He greatest dream is to be able to improve his business in order for his financial situation to change.

loans.use: to improve his juice stand and to buy merchandise.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a resident of the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and owns a public transport business that has been in operation for the last two years. He owns a three-wheeler vehicle locally known as a ‘tuk tuk."
John learnt about Milango through a friend and joined the organization with the goal of accessing credit to improve the operations of his business. His main challenge is the high cost of spares. 
John is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to repair/service the vehicle. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. He aspires to own other vehicles.

loans.use: To repair/service the vehicle for his public transport business.

loans.name: Jury Liliana

texts.es: Yuri es una mujer que ha tenido claro que es lo que quiere en la vida, con su mirada siempre puesta en las oportunidades que se le presentan, lucha cada día por alcanzar sus metas. Esta joven trabaja en el centro de la ciudad vendiendo carcasas de celular, negocio que logró tener gracias a la dedicación y al esfuerzo. Hoy va más allá, desea expandir su empresa y para ello necesita invertir en más surtido, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para financiar dicho proyecto. Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar su calidad de vida y ver crecer su empresa.
texts.en: Jury is a woman who knows what she wants in life and is always focused on the opportunities that lie ahead. She struggles every day to reach her goals.  This young woman works in the center of the city selling cell phone covers, a business that succeeded thanks to her dedication and effort. Today Jury is going further. She wants to expand her business, and for this she needs to invest in merchandise. She is requesting a loan to finance said project. Her greatest dream is to be able to improve her quality of life and see her business grow.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock for his business.

loans.name: Luis Roberto

texts.es: Luis Roberto  de 52 años de edad, se dedica al reciclaje, actividad de la que se siente muy orgulloso porque manifiesta que su labor no sólo lo beneficia a él si no al planeta. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a esta actividad, la cual es su única forma de ganarse la vida y de sostener a su familia. Afirma que su mayor deseo es convertirse en un microempresario por lo cual ha tomado la determinación de solicitar un  crédito con el que comprará mercancía para vender en los pueblos en la temporada de fin de año con la esperanza de que su situación económica mejore y con ello su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luis Roberto is 52 years old. He deals in recycled goods. He is very proud to do this work because it is not only of benefit to himself but also to the planet. He has worked in this business for 10 years, and it is the only way that he has to earn a living and support his family. Luis Roberto's greatest wish is to become a micro-entrepreneur, and for this reason he has decided to apply for a loan. With it, he intends to buy merchandise to sell in the villages during the end of year season, in the hope that his financial situation will improve, and with it his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (clothes)

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es: Luz Amparo de 47 años de edad, nunca se imaginó que terminaría montando un taller de confección. “Las circunstancias a veces te acorralan y haces cosas que tu no imaginas” con estas palabras doña luz comienza a relatarnos que su negocio inició el día en que su esposo se separó de ella. Con 4 hijos, ella necesitaba alternativas para generar ingresos y poder sostener a sus hijos, por lo cual comenzó realizando arreglos a sus vecinas y posteriormente con unos ahorros compró algunas máquinas para laborarle a terceros y aumentar sus ingresos. En estos momentos su negocio ha ido creciendo por lo cual necesita una inversión en insumos para poder realizar la producción que le han solicitado para fin de año, por esta razón solicita un crédito ya que no cuenta con recursos propio para realizar esta inversión.
texts.en:
Luz Amparo, age 47, never imagined that she would end up establishing a seamstress shop.  “Sometimes circumstances corner you, and you do things you never image.”  With these words Luz starts to tell us that she started her business the day her husband separated from her.  With four children, she needed ways to generate income and support her children.  Therefore, she started making repairs for her neighbors.  Later she used her savings to buy some machines in order to work for third parties and increase her income.

Her business has now been growing, and she needs to invest in supplies for the production that has been requested for the end of the year.  For this reason she is requesting a loan because she does not have her own resources to make this investment.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fabric and thread.

loans.name: Luz Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 58 años de edad, es una mujer que le gusta rebuscarse la vida, es ama de casa, pero también una mujer de negocios. Las obligaciones del hogar no le permiten estar mucho tiempo por fuera, por lo cual se ha dedicado a la venta de productos por catálogo, generándole ingresos que destina para los gastos del hogar y para comprar sus cosas personales. Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de mercancía, debido a que sus ventas se han aumentan en la temporada de diciembre y no quiere dejar escapar un solo cliente
texts.en: Margarita is 58 years old and is a woman who likes to reinvent her life.  She is a housewife but also a businesswoman.  Her household obligations don’t allow her to too much time out of the home, so she decided to sell products via catalog.  She normally uses the income toward the household expenses and to buy things for herself.  She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise because her sales increase during December and she doesn’t want to lose even one single customer.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: “La creatividad es un don que todo ser humano posee pero muy pocos desarrollan”. Nancy es una mujer que sabe bien qué es lo que quiere, su capacidad de imaginación y creatividad le han permitido construir su negocio a pulso consistente en la elaboración de cuadernos, agendas y libretas, con la cual sostiene económicamente su hogar. En estos momentos se encuentra solicitando un crédito debido a que en el mes de enero llega la temporada escolar y necesita comprar los insumos para elaborar la producción que comercializará para esta fecha. Su mayor deseo es expandir su negocio y poder generar fuentes de empleo.
texts.en:
"Creativity is a gift which all human beings possess but which very few develop". Nancy is a woman who knows exactly what she wants. Her creativity and imagination have enabled her to consistently build her business making exercise books, diaries and notebooks, the income from which allows her to cover her household costs.

She is applying for a loan now, as the new school year starts in January and she needs to buy supplies to make the goods which she will market for that time.  Her greatest wish is to expand her business and to be able to create jobs.

loans.use: to buy supplies for manufacturing exercise books

loans.name: Norelia Amparo

texts.es: Norelia es una amante a su trabajo, desde niña soñaba con ser  la mejor confeccionista, y hoy es su realidad. Dedicada desde su juventud a realizar los encargos que diariamente le solicitaban sus vecinas fue como doña Norelia adquirió la experiencia que hoy la acredita como una gran eminencia del oficio. Su mayor sueño es poder montar un gran taller y poderle brindar a muchas personas la oportunidad de emplearse, al mismo tiempo que pretende que su situación económica mejore. En búsqueda de este propósito ella se encuentra solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos que requiere para comenzar con el pie derecho la temporada de fin de año.
texts.en:
Norelia is a lover of her work.  Since she was a girl, she dreamed of being the best clothing manufacturer.  Today, this is her reality.  She has made a living since she was young in filling the daily orders that her neighbors have asked for.  It was as Mrs. Norelia that she acquired this experience that she today credits as a great power and leading light in her service.

Her biggest dream is to be able to set up a large sewing workshop and to be able to offer many people an opportunity to be employed while at the same time trying to improve her own economic situation.  In chasing this dream, she is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy the materials that she needs in order to start the New Year season off on the right foot.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stocks of flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Dúo El Calvario Comalapense Group

texts.es:
DUO 
EL CALVARIO
ESTA INTEGRADO POR DOÑA CONCHA ELLA ES ORIGINARIA DEL MUNICIPIO DE SAN JUAN COMALAPA DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE CHIMALTENANGO, ELLA ES CASADA Y TIENE A SUS HIJOS YA GRANDES QUIENES LA APOYAN EN LA ELABORACION DE SUS PRODUCTOS, DOÑA CONCHA TIENE SESENTA AÑOS DE EDAD SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE TEJIDOS EN TELAR ELLA ELABORA DIFERENTES PRODUCTOS, DOÑA CONCHA ELABORA GUIPILES Y SERVILLETAS ELLA REALIZA SUS VENTAS EN EL PUEBLO PORQUE AI ES EN DONDE LE ENCARGAN EL PRODUCTO PERO AHORA NECESITA SU CREDITO PARA POSER AMPLIAR SUS NEGOCIOS PORQUE HA TENIDO MUCHA DEMANDA, TAMBIEN PARTE DEL CREDITO LO UTILIZARA EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA ELABORACION DE TEJIDOS TIPICOS.
texts.en:
Doña Concha is one of the members of the Duo El Calvario group. She is a native of the town of San Juan Comalapa in the department of Chimaltenango. She is married and all of her children are now adults who help her produce her goods.

Doña Concha is 70 years old and she is a weaver who makes different products. She weaves guipiles (traditional blouses) and napkins. She makes her sales in the village because that is where she gets her orders for goods. Now, however, she needs a loan in order to expand her business because there is such a high demand. She will also use part of the loan to purchase the basic materials she uses to make her traditional woven goods.

loans.use: to purchase basic materials to make her traditional woven goods.

loans.name: Dúo Las Iluciones Group

texts.es: Dúo las Iluciones, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Maria Elena Quien se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales naturales, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, gracias a Dios durante este tiempo se a superado poco a poco, está solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la compra de mas mercaderia en productos medicinales naturales, ya que de esa forma podra aumentar sus venta espera que kiva le pueda ayudar con el credito solicitad.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Elena is a member of the Dúo Las Iluciones group. She sells natural medicinal products and has had this business for the past 10 years. During this time, thankfully, she has gradually achieved success. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase more natural medicinal merchandise so that she can increase her sales. She hopes that Kiva can help her with the loan she needs.

loans.use: to purchase natural medicines.

loans.name: Dúo Caminando Con Cristo Group

texts.es:
DUO CAMINANDO CON CRISTO
Doña Silvia es originaria de la aldea Xenimajuyu municipio de Tecpan, tiene 30 años de edad, tiene bajo su responsabilidad a 3 hijos menores de edad y se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos a mano.
Desde hace algunos años ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano porque es el medio  que ella tiene para salir adelante con su familia ya que ahora ya es conocida en el mercado por sus tejidos.
El esposo de ella trabaja como jornalero y gracias al apoyo de él doña Silvia sigue trabajando para mejor la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio tener suficiente materia prima para obtener mejores ganancias y asi poder mandar a sus hijos a una mejor escuela para un futuro mejor.Solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos.
texts.en:
This is the "Duo Caminando con Cristo" group.

Silvia is from the village of Xenimajuyu in Tecpan municipality. She is 30 years old and cares for three minor children. She works making handwoven items.

She has been a weaver for some years because it is the means she has to help her family get ahead in life. She is already known in the market for her weaving.

Her husband works as a day laborer, and thanks to his support, Silvia continues working to improve her children's quality of life.

Her dream is to expand her business and have sufficient raw material so that she can earn more. This will enable her to send her children to a better school so that they can have a better future. She is applying for the loan in order to buy raw material for her weaving.

loans.use: To buy raw material for doing traditional weaving.

loans.name: Dúo Jeremias Group

texts.es: Dúo Jeremias.  Este dúo Esta conformado por Brenda es originaria de Sumpango, además es madre de familia, todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para poder ir a realizar sus labores que es la compra y venta de verduras, Brenda se levanta desde las tres de la madrugada ya que en el mercado en donde ella vende la gente acostumbra a negociar desde muy temprano por esa razón ella tiene que madrugar y aprovechar el tiempo ya que así logra tener un poco mas de ganancia, y ahora que se acerca la época navideña las ventas aumentan por tal razón solicita un crédito para poder comprar mas mercaderia en verduras y asi mismo vender más de lo de siempre, ella promete cumplir con cada pago si se les llegara a autorizar ya que es la segunda vez que solicitan y han sido muy responsables.
texts.en:
This is the group "Dúo Jeremias" [Jeremiah Duo].  This duo includes Brenda.  She is from Sumpango and is the mother of a family.  Every day, she gets up very early to be able to do her work, which is buying and selling vegetables.  Brenda gets up at three in the morning, since at the market where she sells, the people are accustomed to start buying at a very early hour.  For this reason, she has to get up early and take advantage of the time and thereby gain higher earnings.  

Now that Christmas time is coming, the sales are growing.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to be able to buy more vegetables so that she can sell more than usual.  She promises to comply with each payment if this loan is authorized.  

This is the second time that they have requested a loan.  They have been very responsible.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
DON ALFONZO
El es originario de la aldea Vista Bella, municipio de tecpan tiene 49 años, bajo su responsabilidad esta su hijo menor de edad, el se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz y venta de leña..
Desde hace años el ha empezado con un pequeño negocio en la comunidad donde vive gracias a Dios poco a poco su negocio ha mejorado ahora ya cuenta con su propia clientela.
La esposa de el se dedica a la venta de tortillas gracias al apoyo de ella don Alfonzo esta siempre atendiendo su negocio.
El sueño de el es ampliar mas el negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y mandar a su hijo a un mejor colegio para un futuro mejor. Esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de maiz y leña para la venta.
texts.en:
Alfonso is from the village of Vista Bella, in the municipality of Tecpan. He is 49 years old. He has one child under his care. He buys and sells corn and also sells wood.
Years ago he started a small business in the community where he lives and, thank God, his business has slowly improved and he has his own customers.
His wife sells tortillas and thanks to her support, Alfonso is always taking care of his business. 
His dream is to expand his business to improve his profit and send his son to a better school for a better future. 
He is asking this loan to buy corn and wood for selling.

loans.use: To buy corn and wood for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room in her parents' home.

loans.name: Dúo Unidos Lucharemos Group

texts.es:
DUO UNIDOS LUCHAREMOS
LILIAN ES ORIGINARIOS DE EL PARAJE LOS PINOS, DESDE HACE MAS DE CINCO AÑOS POSEE UNA CRIANZA DE POLLOS EN EL CUAL POSEE GALLINAS PONEDORAS, POLLITOS, Y PAVOS LOS CUALES SON MUY COMERCIALIZADOS EN LA REGION  Y LOS CUALES VENDE EN EL MERCADO DE LA LOCALIDAD. SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA COMPRAR COMCENTRADO  POR QUINTAL Y DOS DOCENAS DE POLLAS PONEDORAS,
texts.en:
“Unidos Lucharemos” (We Will Fight Together) Group.

Lilian is from Paraje Los Pinos and has had a chicken farm for more than five years where laying hens, chicks and turkeys are raised that are widely sold throughout the region; she sells them in the local market.  She’s requesting the loan to buy feed by the quintal and to buy two dozen laying hens.

loans.use: to buy laying hens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Santos Alejandro

texts.es: Santos tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Él tiene 25 años de dedicarse a la venta de especies y dulces, lo heredo de sus padres y posteriormente él ha seguido trabajando por su propia cuenta. El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar más especies, dulces y ropa para vender en la temporada de fin de año. Lo que desea, es que su negocio este bien establecido para obtener ingresos que le permitan mejorar las condiciones en que vive su familia.
texts.en: Santos, 39, is married with one child. He’s been running a business selling sweets and spices for 25 years. He inherited it from his parents and continues to run it on his own. The loan he is requesting is to buy more spices, sweets and clothing to sell for New Year's festivities. He wants his business to become well established in order to generate income that will improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: buy more spices, sweets and clothing to sell for New Year's festivities.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora María  de 41 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tortillas,( leña , cal y frijol) desde hace  15 años tiene su tienda ubicada en su domicilio, ella necesita otro crédito para la compra de (frijol,cal leña y veladoras) y asi seguir creciendo en sus ventas  ya que se acerca las fechas navideñas y  así  poder invertir más en la elaboración de veladoras aromáticas   que con la ayuda de su esposo logran tener un  pequeño local  en la feria navideña del pueblo de San Juan Sacatepequez,
texts.en: María, 41, has sold tortillas (firewood, lime powder and beans) for 15 years.  Her store is home-based.  She needs another loan to buy beans, lime powder, firewood and candles to continue increasing sales because the Christmas season is approaching and she can invest more into making aromatic candles and with her husband’s help will be able to have a small stand in the town of San Juan Sacatepéquez’s Christmas market.

loans.use: to buy beans, lime powder, firewood and candles.

loans.name: Las Rosas De San Salvador Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ROSAS DE SAN SALVADOR”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: macramé de mantas, confección de mantas, confección de polleras, venta de productos YAMBAL, repostería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio costura de polleras; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre hace años y decidió realizar su propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas de venta por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Las Rosas de San Salvador” (San Salvador’s Roses) will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Focal Center.  It has six members led by a governing board presided over by Lucia.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses among which are macramé blankets, blanket weaving, shirt making, selling Yambal products and pastry making.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen one of which is Lucia.  She indicates that this is the first time she’s been part of Pro Mujer having joined thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend who’s a member of the institution.  She currently has a business sewing shirts.  She relates that she learned this business from her mother years ago and decided to set up her own workshop.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy fabric from wholesalers and after she makes them will sell to order.  This way of working makes it possible for her to support her home the best way possible since she’s single and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Tilata A Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TILATA A”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Adela, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Miriam es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de tucumanas, cosmetología, venta de coca, venta de comida, venta de frescos, venta de tejido de lana.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Miriam es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio atención en cosmetología; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace años ya que estudio en un instituto de formación, posteriormente decidió implementar un espacio especializado, donde atiende diariamente a las personas.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cremas humectadoras) que adquirirá de las tiendas de venta por mayor y lo implementará en su espacio de servicio o realizará visitas a domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Tilata A” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Focal Center.  It has six members led by a governing board presided by Miriam.  The members carry out a variety of businesses among which is the sale of turnovers, cosmetology, coca sales, food sales, blended fruit drink sales and woolens sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen.  One of them is Miriam who indicates that this is the first time she’s been part of Pro Mujer having joined thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a cosmetology business.  She relates that she learned the business years ago because she took courses in training institute and later on decided to set up a specialized space where she takes care of people daily.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She’ll buy moisturizing creams from wholesale stores and will either use them at her service space or during customer home visits.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her home however possible since she’s married and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health services and the credit.

loans.use: to buy moisturizing creams.

loans.name: Rosas De Cascada Group

texts.es:
C.F. CASCADA
A.C. ROSAS DE CASCADA
FECHA: 14/11/12
La A.C. “ROSAS DE CASCADA”  iniciará el decimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ana María es la Tesorera.
